\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 6.3969em; vertical-align: -2.9484em;"></span><span class="mo"><span Heat Transferred (the only difference with Adiabatic process)</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math is a constant volume cycle.</em></p><p>1.) A certain quantity of air has a volume of <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0.028</mn><msup><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0.028m^3</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.81em;"></span><span class="mo">0.028</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> at a pressure of 1.25 bar and <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mn>25</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">25^\circ C</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mo">2</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">5</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.6741em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mbin mtight">∘</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span></span></span></span></span>. It is compressed to a volume of <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0.0042</mn><msup><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0.0042m^3</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.81em;"></span><span class="mo">0.0042</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>. According to the law <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><msup><mi>V</mi><mn>1.3</mn></msup><mo>≈</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">PV^{1.3} \approx C</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.81em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1.3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">≈</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span></span></span></span></span>, find the final temp and work done during compression. Also determine the reduction in pressure at a constant volume required to bring the air back to its original temp</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.25em" columnalign="right left" columnspacing="0em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{aligned}
V_1 &amp;amp;= 0.028m^3 \\
P_1 &amp;amp;= 1.25 \text{ bars} \times 10^5 \\
T_1 &amp;amp;= 25^\circ C + 273K = 298K \\
V_2 &amp;amp;= 0.0042m^3 \\
T_2 &amp;amp;= ? \\
W_2 &amp;amp;= ? \\
P_2 &amp;amp;= ? \\
PV^{1.3} &amp;amp;= C \\
n &amp;amp;= 1.3 \\
\end{aligned}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 13.5964em; vertical-align: -6.5482em;"></span><span class="mo"><span scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mn>1.25</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup></mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac></mstyle></mtd><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow></mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mo separator="true">;</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo fence="true">[</mo><mfrac><mn>0.0042</mn><mn>0.028</mn></mfrac><mo fence="true">]</mo></mrow><mn>1.3</mn></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>125000</mn><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac></mstyle></mtd><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow></mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mo separator="true">;</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.15</mn><msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mn>1.3</mn></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" separator="true">;</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0.084902</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{aligned}
\frac{298}{T_2} &amp;amp;= (0.15)^{0.3} \\
\frac{298}{T_2} &amp;amp;= 0.5660 \\
T_2 &amp;amp;= \frac{298}{0.5660} = 526.49K \text{ or } 253.49^\circ \\
\frac{P_1}{P_2} &amp;amp;= \left[ \frac{V_2}{V_1} \right]^n \\
\frac{1.25 \times 10^5}{P_2} &amp;amp;= \left[ \frac{0.0042}{0.028} \right]^{1.3} \\
\frac{125000}{P_2} &amp;amp;= (0.15)^{1.3} \\
\frac{125000}{P_2} &amp;amp;= 0.084902
\end{aligned}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 17.7956em; vertical-align: -8.6478em;"></span><span class="mo"><span 0.954em;"><span style="top: -3.2029em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><hr><p>Heat engine cycle.</p><p>At heat is transferred from furnace to boiler.</p><p>At work is produced in turbine rotor.</p><p>At steam is condensed in condenser.</p><p>Operation of carnot cycle.</p><p>Boiler generates steam at high pressure and higher temp. The steam turbine converts to heat energy of the steam into mechanical energy.</p><p>The generator then converts to mechanical energy into electric power.</p><p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-8fe7ef5d.jpeg" alt="img-17.jpeg"></p><p>CS CamScanne</p><p>CS CamScanner</p><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="c9189533">STEAM POWER PLANTS → It undergoes a cyclic process.<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#c9189533" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="vapour-cycles">Vapour Cycles<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#vapour-cycles" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div><p>→ The working substance is steam. It can be
① wet steam, Dry steam, Saturated steam and
in Substituent steam.</p><p>→ The steam power plant vapour cycles are:
① Carnot cycle
② Rankine
③ Rankine wit Supeshest</p><p>→ If efficiency can be increased by decreasing the lowest temp.
→ (Net change of internal energy in a steam power plant is zero)</p><p>→ It has the following parts.
• Boiler
• Turbine
• Condenser
• Compressor</p><p>→ It is a reversible cycle. Can ideal hypothetical cycle?
① Schematic diagram of a Carnot cycle.</p><p>Quasistatic → Isothermal → Steam turbine (work output) → adiabatic</p><p>(heat is received)

↑ ↑ ↑
↑ ↑ ↑
↑ ↑ ↑</p><p>→ Condenser → (heat is rejected)
Pout → Isothermal → (work input)
→ Compressor (work input)
Win</p><ul><li>Entropy: (S) Jlkgk or KJlkgk.
→ It is the level of disorder in a system
→ Increase in temp increases entropy.
T ∝ S → Increase in entropy increases temperature
→ T = KS</li></ul><p>② P-V diagram of a Carnot cycle.</p><p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-ef66b4ce.jpeg" alt="img-18.jpeg"></p><p>Joules work</p><ul><li>heat is a low grade energy</li><li>work is a high grade energy</li><li>complete conversion of low grade energy into high grade energy in a cycle is impossible</li></ul><p>③ T-S diagram of a Carnot cycle.</p><div class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;(JkgK)</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>Efficiency of a Carnot cycle → Is the ratio of work done by the working substance in one cycle to the amount of heat extracted from the source?</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mtext>Efficiency</mtext><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mtext>Work&nbsp;output</mtext><mtext>Work&nbsp;input</mtext></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mtext>net&nbsp;work&nbsp;output</mtext><mtext>total&nbsp;heat&nbsp;input</mtext></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\text{Efficiency} = \frac{\text{Work output}}{\text{Work input}} = \frac{\text{net work output}}{\text{total heat input}}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mtext>Work&nbsp;done</mtext><mtext>Heat&nbsp;extracted</mtext></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mi>c</mi></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n = \frac{\text{Work done}}{\text{Heat extracted}} = \frac{(S_2 - S_1)(T_1 - T_3)}{(S_2 / S_1) T_1} = \frac{T_1 - T_3}{T_1} = \frac{T_1}{T_1} - \frac{T_3}{T_1} = \frac{1 - T_3}{T_1} = n_c</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span><span class="ms" class="mo">29.78%</span></span></span></span></span></div><ul><li>Heat transfer into a system is more than work transfer out of the system? What happens?</li></ul><p>→ Internal energy of the system remains constant.</p><ul><li>The term which can differentiate thermodynamic from other science is? Temperature</li></ul><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="rankine-cycle">RANKINE CYCLE<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#rankine-cycle" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div><p>→ Coal-fired Power Plants or Nuclear Reactors.</p><p>→ It is the ideal cycle for finding the performance of a steam plant:
→ It is also called a modified Carnot cycle. ☑</p><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="components-of-rankine-cycle">Components of Rankine Cycle<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#components-of-rankine-cycle" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div><ol><li>Boiler</li><li>Turbine</li><li>Condenser</li><li>Extraction Pump</li><li>Hotwell</li><li>Feed Pump</li></ol><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="schematic-diagram-of-rankine-cycle">Schematic diagram of Rankine Cycle<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#schematic-diagram-of-rankine-cycle" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div><p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-dd9df9da.jpeg" alt="img-21.jpeg"></p><p>CS CamScanne</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>V</mi><mtext>&nbsp;diagram</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P - V \text{ diagram}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.7667em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s47"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;diagram</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="center" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>⇒</mo><mtext>isobaric</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>⇒</mo><mtext>Isentropic/Adiabatic</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>⇒</mo><mtext>Isobaric</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>⇒</mo><mtext>Isentropic/adiabatic</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{c}
1 - 2 \Rightarrow \text{isobaric} \\
2 - 3 \Rightarrow \text{Isentropic/Adiabatic} \\
3 - 4 \Rightarrow \text{Isobaric} \\
4 - 1 \Rightarrow \text{Isentropic/adiabatic} \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 4.8em; vertical-align: -2.15em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
Q_R = \frac{h_2 - h_3}{h_2 - hf_3} \\
h_2 = hf_2 + x_2 hf_{g_2} \\
hf_2 = hf \text{ at } P_1 = 12 \text{ bars} = 798 \text{ kJ/kg} \\
hf_{g_2} = hfg \text{ at } P_1 = 12 \text{ bars} = 1986 \text{ kJ/kg} \\
x = 1 \text{ (Lies on the curve)}
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 6.1773em; vertical-align: -2.8387em;"></span><span class="mo"><span h_3 = h f_3 + x_3 h f_{g_3} \\
h f_3 = hf \text{ at } 0.1 \text{ bars} = 192 \text{ KJ/kg} \\
h f_{g_3} = hf_g \text{ at } 0.1 \text{ bars} = 2392 \text{ KJ/kg} \\
\text{get } x_3 \\
S_2 = S_3 \\
S_2 = S_g \text{ at boiler pressure} = 12 \text{ bars} \\
= 6.523 \text{ KJ/kg K} \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 8.4em; vertical-align: -3.95em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>192</mn><mo>+</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.7832</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>2392</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2065.41</mn><mtext>&nbsp;KJ/kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">∇</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><munder><munder><mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow><mo stretchy="true">⏟</mo></munder><mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><mi>h</mi><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></munder></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo fence="true">(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2784</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2065.41</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2784</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>192</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo fence="true">)</mo></mrow><mo>×</mo><mn>100</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">%</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.2772</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>100</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">%</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>27.72</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">%</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">✓</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
S_3 = S f_3 + x_3 S f_{g_3} \\
S f_3 = S f \text{ at condenser pressure at } 0.1 \text{ bars} \\
= 0.649 \text{ KJ/kg K} \\
S f_{g_3} = S f_g \text{ at condenser pressure at } 0.1 \text{ bars} \\
= 7.5 \text{ KJ/kg K} \\
\text{Since } S_2 = S_3 \\
S_3 = S f_3 + x_3 S f_{g_3} \\
6.523 = 0.649 + (x_3 \times 7.5) \\
6.523 = 0.649 + 7.5 x_3 \\
6.523 - 0.649 = 7.5 x_3 \\
7.5 \\
x_3 = 0.7832 \\
h_3 = h f_3 + x_3 h f_{g_3} \\
= 192 + (0.7832 \times 2392) \\
= 2065.41 \text{ KJ/kg} \\
\nabla_R = \underbrace{h_2 - h_3}_{h_2 - h f_3} \\
= \left( \frac{2784 - 2065.41}{2784 - 192} \right) \times 100\% \\
= 0.2772 \times 100\% \\
= 27.72\% \checkmark \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 24.1135em; vertical-align: -11.8068em;"></span><span class="mo"><span CamScanner</p><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="csup-specific-heat-of-superheated-steam">Csup - Specific heat of superheated steam<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#csup-specific-heat-of-superheated-steam" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div><ol><li>4 Kg of 0.5 dry steam at 6 bar pressure is heated so that it becomes;
a) 0.95 dry at 6 bar pressure.
b) Superheated to 250°C at 8 bar
Using steam tables determine in each case the quantity of heat required to be supplied. Take <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>C</mi><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2.3</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>KJ</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>Kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">C_{sup} = 2.3 \, \text{KJ} \cdot \text{Kg} \cdot \text{K}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.9694em; vertical-align: -0.2861em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.1514em;"><span class="s38"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">s</span><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">u</span><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">p</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.2861em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mo">2.3</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">KJ</span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">⋅</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">Kg</span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">⋅</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">K</span></span></span></span></span></span></li></ol><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="sln">SLn<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#sln" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.25em" columnalign="right left" columnspacing="0em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle width="1em"></mspace><mi>P</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>bar</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{aligned}
m &amp;amp; = 4 \, \text{Kg} \\
x_1 &amp;amp; = 0.5 \\
P &amp;amp; = 6 \, \text{bar} \\
a) \quad x_2 &amp;amp; = 0.95 \\
P &amp;amp; = 6 \, \text{bar} \\
b) \quad \text{Superheated } 250^\circ \text{C}, \quad P = 8 \, \text{bar}
\end{aligned}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 9em; vertical-align: -4.25em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="col-align-r"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 4.75em;"><span style="top: -6.91em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span></span></span><span style="top: -5.41em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s35"><span class="ps" style="height: h g = 2951 \\
C_{sup} = 2.3 \, \text{KJ} / \text{Kg} \cdot \text{K} \\
t_{sup} = 250^{\circ} \text{C} \\
t_{sat} = 170.4^{\circ} \text{C} \\
h_2 = 2951 + 2.3 (250 - 170.4) \\
h_2 = 3134.08 \, \text{KJ} / \text{Kg} \times 4 \\
= 12536.32 \, \text{KJ} \\
\varphi = (12536.32 - 6854) \\
= 5682.32 \, \text{KJ} \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 10.8em; vertical-align: -5.15em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s35"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">2951</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo">2.3</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo">250</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo">170.4</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span><span style="top: -1.81em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><ol start="2"><li>Consider 2Kg of steam with the following parameters, extracted from the table.</li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>h</mi><mi>f</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>720.9</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>KJ</mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mtext>Kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
h f = 720.9 \, \text{KJ} / \text{Kg} \\
h g = 2767.4 \, \text{KJ} / \text{Kg} \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 2.4em; vertical-align: -0.95em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span style="height: 0.95em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>If the dryness fraction is 0.8, calculate the total heat of the system.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" x = 0.8 \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 2.4em; vertical-align: -0.95em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2933.968</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>KJ</mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mtext>Kg</mtext><mo>×</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>Kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5869.736</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>KJ</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
\varphi = h_2 - h_1 \\
h_1 = h f_1 + x h f g_1 \\
h_1 = 720.9 + (0.8 \times 2767.46) \\
= 2933.968 \, \text{KJ} / \text{Kg} \times 2 \, \text{Kg} \\
= 5869.736 \, \text{KJ} \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 6em; vertical-align: -2.75em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span 2.75em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mtext>Kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2358.12</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>KJ</mtext><mi encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
h = h f + x h f g \\
720.9 + (0.8 \times 2046.53) \, \text{KJ} / \text{Kg} \\
= 2358.12 \, \text{KJ} / \text{Kg} \times 2 \\
= 4716.248 \, \text{KJ} \quad \checkmark \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 4.8em; vertical-align: -2.15em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 2.65em;"><span style="top: -4.81em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo">0.8</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo">2046.53</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">KJ</span></span><span class="mo">/</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">Kg</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -2.41em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">2358.12</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span style="margin-right: 1em;"></span><span class="mord amsrm">✓</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 2.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>☑ Dryness fraction (x) is defined as the ratio of the mass of dry steam and the combined mass of dry steam and mass of water vapour in the mixture.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mtext>Mass&nbsp;of&nbsp;vapour&nbsp;(mv)</mtext><mrow><mtext>Mass&nbsp;of&nbsp;vapour&nbsp;(mv)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>Mass&nbsp;of&nbsp;liquid&nbsp;(ml)</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">= \frac{\text{Mass of vapour (mv)}}{\text{Mass of vapour (mv)} + \text{Mass of liquid (ml)}}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.3669em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 2.363em; vertical-align: -0.936em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.427em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">Mass&nbsp;of&nbsp;vapour&nbsp;(mv)</span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">Mass&nbsp;of&nbsp;liquid&nbsp;(ml)</span></span></span></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">Mass&nbsp;of&nbsp;vapour&nbsp;(mv)</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.936em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>CS CamScanner</p><div mathrm">T</span></span></span></span></span></div><p>CS CamScanne</p><ol start="2"><li>A block of metal of mass 1.5 Kg which is suitably insulated is heated from 30°C to 50°C in 8 minutes and 20 seconds by an electric heater coil rated 54 watts. Find;</li></ol><p>a) The quantity of heat supplied by the heater.</p><p>b) The heat capacity of the block.</p><p>c) The specific heat capacity of the block.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.25em" columnalign="right left" encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{aligned}
m &amp;amp;= 1.5 \text{ Kg} \\
\varnothing &amp;amp;= T_2 - T_1 = (50 - 30^\circ \text{C}) = 20^\circ \text{C} \\
\text{Time (t)} &amp;amp;= 8 \text{ min } 20 \text{ sec } = (8 \times 60 + 20) = 500 \text{ sec}. \\
P &amp;amp;= 54 \text{ W}
\end{aligned}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 6em; vertical-align: -2.75em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mo separator="true">;</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>42</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>300</mn><mo mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{r l}
Q &amp;amp; = P \times t \\
&amp;amp; = (42 \times 300) \\
&amp;amp; = 12600 \text{J}.
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 3.6em; vertical-align: -1.55em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{r l}
4200 \times 0.05 \times T_2 - 1 &amp;amp; = 12600 \\
210 \times T_2 - 4200 &amp;amp; 12600 \\
210 \times T_2 = 12600 + 4200 &amp;amp; \\
T_2 = 80^\circ \text{C} &amp;amp; T_2 = 80^\circ \text{C}
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 4.8em; vertical-align: -2.15em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="v" style="height: 2.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>Determination of Specific Heat Capacity</p><p>→ There are different methods of determining specific heat capacity; namely:</p><ol><li>Method of mixture</li><li>Mechanical methods</li><li>Electrical methods</li><li>Continuous flow methods.</li></ol><p>→ The methods used are called Calorimetry.</p><p>Throttling calorimeter → Is used for measuring very high dryness up to 0.98.</p><p>→ It is quessel with a needle valve fitted on the inside inlet side.</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><table><thead><tr><th>Material</th><th>c (J/kg·K)</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Water</td><td>4200</td></tr><tr><td>Alcohol</td><td>2300</td></tr><tr><td>Kerosene</td><td>2200</td></tr><tr><td>Ice</td><td>2100</td></tr><tr><td>Aluminium</td><td>900</td></tr><tr><td>Glass</td><td>830</td></tr><tr><td>Iron</td><td>460</td></tr><tr><td>Copper</td><td>390</td></tr><tr><td>Mercury</td><td>140</td></tr><tr><td>Lead</td><td>130</td></tr></tbody></table><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="example-of-a-calorimetry">Example of a Calorimetry<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#example-of-a-calorimetry" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" encoding="application/x-tex">\text{Heat lost by } m\text{cal} = H\text{cal} + H\text{cal} \text{, gained by } H_2O + H_2O \text{ and } H_2\text{O}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">O</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>m</mi><mtext>cal</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><msub><mtext>c</mtext><mn>0</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>m</mi><msub><mtext>c</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub><mo m\text{c}_0(T_2 - T_1) + m\text{c}_1(T_2 - T_1)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">c</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span></div><ol><li>A lagged copper calorimeter of mass 0.75 kg contains 0.9 kg of H₂O at 20°C. A bolt of mass 0.8 kg is transferred from an oven at 400°C to the calorimeter and a steady temperature of 50°C is reached by the H₂O after stirring. Calculate the specific heat capacity of the</li></ol><p>CS CamScanne</p><p>material of the bolt. (Take specific heat capacity of copper as 400J/kgK and CH₂O = 4200J/kgK)</p><p>Solution</p><p>Mass of the copper calorimeter = 0.75Kg
Upper calorimeter = Bolt.
Mass of H₂O = 0.9Kg
T₁ = 20°C
T₂ = 50°C
T₃ = 50°C
T₄ = 50°C
T₁ = 400°C
T₂ = 50°C
T₁ = 50°C
C = 400J/kgK
C = ?</p><p>Heat lost by the Bolt
Heat gained by calorimeter + Heat gained by H₂O.
MCO = MCO + MCO.
(0.8 × C × 350) = (0.75 × 400 × 30) + (0.9 × 4200 × 30)
280°C = 9000 + 113400
280°C / 280 = 122400 / 280
C = 437.14J/kgK.</p><p>2.) A block of iron of mass 125Kg at 120°C was transferred to aluminium calorimeter of mass 0.3Kg containing a liquid of mass 0.6Kg at 25°C. The block and the calorimeter with its contents eventually reach a common temp of 50°C. Given the specific heat capacity of iron as 450J/kgK and that of aluminium is 900J/kgK, calculate the specific heat capacity of the liquid.</p><table><thead><tr><th>liquid</th><th>aluminium</th><th>iron block</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>M = 0.6Kg</td><td>calorimeter</td><td></td></tr><tr><td>C = 900J/kgK</td><td>M = 125Kg</td><td></td></tr><tr><td>T₁ = 25°C</td><td>M = 0.3Kg</td><td>T₁ = 120°C</td></tr><tr><td>T₂ = 50°C</td><td>T₁ = 25°C</td><td>T₂ = 50°C</td></tr><tr><td>C = ?</td><td>T₂ = 50°C</td><td>C = 450J/kgK</td></tr></tbody></table><p>Heat lost by the iron
Heat gained by calorimeter + Heat gained by the liquid.
MCO = MCO + MCO.</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>125</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>450</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>70</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0.3</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>900</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>+</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.6</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>25</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>3937500</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>6750</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>150</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>15</mn><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3937500</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>6750</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>15</mn><mi>c</mi></mrow><mn>15</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3930750</mn><mn>15</mn></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>262050</mn><mi>J</mi><mi>K</mi><msup><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mi>K</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
125 \times 450 \times 70 = 0.3 \times 900 \times 25 + (0.6 \times 25)c \\
3937500 = 6750 + 150 \\
15c = 3937500 - 6750 \\
\frac{15c}{15} = \frac{3930750}{15} \\
c = 262050 J Kg^{-1} K^{-1}
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 6.0051em; vertical-align: -2.7526em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 3.2526em;"><span style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">−</span><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">K</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span mtight">1</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 2.7526em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>1.) A piston cylinder contains air at 600 KPa, 290 K and a volume of 0.01 m³. A constant pressure process gives 54 kJ of work out. What is the final volume of the air?</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>600000</mn><mi>P</mi><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>290</mn><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.01</mn><msup><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mtext>Workdone</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>54</mn><mi>k</mi><mi>J</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">?</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>∫</mo><mi>P</mi><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>54</mn><mn>600</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.09</mn><msup><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.01</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.09</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.1</mn><msup><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
P_1 = 600000 Pa \\
T_1 = 290 K \\
V_1 = 0.01 m^3 \\
\text{Workdone} = 54 kJ \\
V_2 = ? \\
W = \int PdV \\
= P \Delta V \Delta V = W / P \\
= \frac{54}{600} = 0.09 m^3
\end{array}
\quad
\begin{array}{l}
V_2 = V_1 + \Delta V = 0.01 + 0.09 \\
= 0.1 m^3
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 9.6051em; vertical-align: -4.5526em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 5.0526em;"><span 4.5526em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right: 1em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.45em;"><span style="top: -3.61em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s17"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s17"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo">Δ</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">0.01</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo">0.09</span></span></span><span style="top: -2.41em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">0.1</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.95em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>2.) What is the mass of a material whose specific heat capacity is 400 J/kg K for a rise in temperature from 15°C to 25°C when heat received is 20 KJ.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>e</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>400</mn><mi>J</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mn>25</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mn>15</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>K</mi><mi>J</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mi>J</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>20</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mi>J</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>400</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
c = \frac{Q}{m e} \\
c = 400 J/kg K \\
e = (T_2 - T_1) = (25^\circ C - 15^\circ C) = 10^\circ C \\
Q = 20 KJ = 20,000 J \\
m = \frac{Q}{c e} \\
m = \frac{20,000 J}{400 \times 10} = 5 kg.
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 7.4966em; vertical-align: -3.4983em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 3.9983em;"><span style="top: -1.1894em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.9244em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">ce</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" class="s10"></span></span><span style="top: -3.4461em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">Q</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.9244em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">400</span><span class="mbin mtight">×</span><span class="mord mtight">10</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" class="s10"></span></span><span style="top: -3.4461em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">20</span><span class="mpunct mtight">,</span><span class="mord mtight">000</span><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.4033em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">5</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03148em;">k</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s31">g</span><span class="mo">.</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 3.4983em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>CS CamScanne</p><ol start="3"><li>50 gm of copper is heated to increase its temperature by 10°C. If the same quantity of heat is given to 10 gm of water, what will be the rise in temperature?</li></ol><p>Mass of copper = 50g = 0.05Kg.
Temp of copper = 10°C.</p><p>Mass of H₂O = 10g = 0.01Kg.
Temp of water = ?</p><p>Q = mcg
Specific heat capacity of copper = 390J/KgK
Specific heat capacity of H₂O = 4200J/KgK</p><p>Q₁ = (0.05 × 390 × 10) = 19.5J
Q₁ = Q₂
19.5 = 0.01 × 4200 × Q₁
19.5 = 420
42 = 42
Q = 4.6°C
ΔT = (10 - 4.6)°C = 5.35°C ≈ 5°C.</p><ol start="4"><li>A closed system of constant volume experiences a temp rise of 25°C when a certain process occurs. The heat transferred in the process is 30 KJ. The specific heat at constant volume for the pure substance comprising the system is 1.2 KJ/KgK, and the system contains 2.5 Kg of this substance.</li></ol><p>Determine:
The internal change in internal energy.</p><p>The work done.
T₁ = 25°C
Cᵥ = 1.2 KJ/KgK
M = 2.5 Kg
Q = 30 KJ.
Q = mcᵥ(T₂ - T₁) = U₂ - U₁</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>30</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2.5</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>1200</mn><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mn>25</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>39</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>3000</mn><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>39</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>75000</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>3000</mn><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>3000</mn><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>75000</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>30</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3000</mn><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><mn>3000</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>45000</mn><mn>3000</mn></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>15</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>u</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><msub><mi>c</mi><mi>v</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2.5</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>1200</mn><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3000</mn><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mi>K</mi><mi>J</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
30,000 = 2.5 \times 1200 (25^\circ - T_1) \\
39,000 = 3000 (25 - T_1) \\
39,000 = 75000 - 3000 T_1 \\
3000 T_1 = 75000 - 30,000 \\
\frac{3000 T_1}{3000} = \frac{45000}{3000} \\
T_1 = 15^\circ C \\
du = m c_v (T_2 - T_1) \\
= 2.5 \times 1200 (25 - 15) \\
= 3000 (10) = 30,000 T_1 \\
= 30,000 KJ \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 12.0484em; vertical-align: -5.7742em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 6.2742em;"><span style="top: -8.4342em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">30</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mo">000</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">2.5</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo">1200</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo">2</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">5</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.6741em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mbin mtight">∘</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span><span style="top: -6.0342em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">39</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mo">000</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">75000</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo">3000</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -4.8342em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">3000</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="s22"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">5</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>CS CamScanne</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><ol start="6"><li>A steady state, 500 Kg/s of steam enters a turbine with specific enthalpy equal to 3500 KJ/kg and specific entropy equals to 6.5 KJ/kgK. It expands reversibly in the turbine to the condenser pressure. Heat loss occurs reversibly in the turbine at a temperature of 500K. If the exit specific enthalpy and specific entropy are 2500 KJ/kg and 6.3 KJ/kgK, respectively, the work output from the turbine is MW (in integer).</li></ol><p>Entropy generation system is represented by equation</p><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>∑</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>φ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mtext>gen</mtext></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">S_2 - S_1 = \sum (\varphi) + S_{\text{gen}}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s48">S</span><span class="mo">&nbsp;MW</span></span></span></span></span></span></p><p>7.) A polytropic process is carried out from an initial pressure of 110 KPa and volume of 5m³ to a final volume of 2.5m³. The polytropic index is given by <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.2</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n = 1.2</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mo">1.2</span></span></span></span></span>. The absolute value of the work done during the process is <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>K</mi><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>p</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">KJ(2d-p)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">K</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo">2</span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span>. Polytropic process <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\rightarrow</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.3669em;"></span><span class="mrel">→</span></span></span></span></span> is any general process in nature and represented by the equation</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><msup><mi>V</mi><mi>n</mi></msup><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">PV^n = c</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.7144em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.7144em;"><span class="s22"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">n</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">c</span></span></span></span></span></div><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span></span></span></span></span> = pressure of the system
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">V</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span></span></span></span></span> = Volume of the system
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span></span> = polytropic index and <span class="math math-inline"><span class="k-error" title="ParseError: KaTeX parse error: Expected 'EOF', got '&amp;' at position 3: 1 &amp;̲lt; n &amp;lt; \gam…" style="color: rgb(204, 0, 0);">1 &amp;lt; n &amp;lt; \gamma</span></span></p><p>Work done in polytropic process is,</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msubsup><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn><mi>n</mi></msubsup><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msubsup><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi></msubsup></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>R</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">W = \frac{P_1 V_1^n - P_2 V_2^n}{n-1} = \frac{mR(T_1 - T_2)}{n-1}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">W</span><span class="ms" class="mo">1.292</span></span></span></span></span></div><p>Sensible heat → The heat supplied to increase the temp of the substance but not the phase change.</p><p>LATENT HEAT → Heat supplied to change the state of a unit mass of any substance without changing its temperature.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>∝</mo><mi>m</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">Q \propto m</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">Q</span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="mord class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.988em; vertical-align: -0.8804em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.1076em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="ps" style="height: class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.8804em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>→ SI unit of latent heat is J/kg.</p><p>Classification of latent heat.</p><p>① Latent heat of fusion.</p><p>→ It is defined as the amount of heat energy that is required to change lg of a solid into liquid at atmospheric pressure at its melting point.</p><p>→ Latent heat of the ice is <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>3.34</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>9</mn></msup><mtext></mtext><mtext>J/kg</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">3.34 \times 10^9 \, \text{J/kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s28"></span><span class="mo">3.34</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.0641em; vertical-align:-.25em;"></span><span class="mo">1</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">9</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">J/kg</span></span></span></span></span></span>.</p><p>CS CamScanner</p><ol start="2"><li>Latent heat of vaporization.
→ The heat absorbed per unit mass of a given material at its boiling point that completely converts the material to a gas at the same temperature
→ Latent heat of water is <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>22.70</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">22.70 \times 10^{5} \mathrm{J} \mathrm{kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s28"></span><span class="mo">22.70</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.0085em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mo">1</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">5</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathrm">J</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathrm" style="margin-right: 0.01389em;">kg</span></span></span></span></span></span>.</li></ol><p>NB: Liquid to solid → Latent heat of solidification
→ Liquid to vapor → Latent heat of evaporation/vaporization.
→ Vapor to liquid → Latent heat of condensation.</p><p>NB: Latent heat of vaporization is directly proportional to the change in pressure.</p><p>1.) In a cannot-engine working on ammonia, the high temp is 60°C and pH is received, the ammonia changes from saturated liquid to saturated vapor. The ammonia-pressure at low temps is 190 kPa.
Find the entropy.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>H</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>∫</mo><mi>T</mi><mi>d</mi><mi>s</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>T</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">2H = \int T d s = T (S_2 - S_1)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mo">2</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 2.2222em; vertical-align: -0.8622em;"></span><span class="mop op-symbol large-op" style="margin-right: 0.44445em; position: relative; top: -0.0011em;">∫</span><span class="ms" mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s48">S</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s48">S</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0576em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>s</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>h</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>997.0</mn><mtext></mtext><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></mrow><mtext></mtext><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">= T_s (f_g) = h_2 - h_1 = h(f_g) = 997.0 \, \mathrm{kJ} \, \mathrm{kg}.</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" 0.3 bar is compressed - Isothermally to 0.1 m³. Calculate find pressure, heat supplied, work done and change in internal energy.</li></ol><p>For isothermal process</p><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><annotation 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mo">1.5</span></span></span></span></span> bar</p><p>In isothermal process there is no change in temperature here.</p><p>No change in internal energy (U)</p><p>So, change in internal energy, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>u</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">du = 0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal">u</span><span class="ms"
