class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>5</mn><mtext>&nbsp;atm</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1200</mn><mtext>&nbsp;mL</mtext><mo>−</mo><mn>500</mn><mtext>&nbsp;mL</mtext><mo J}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">W</span><span class="ms" class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>C</mi><mi>m</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>4242.7</mn><mn>2.794</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1518.50</mn><mtext>&nbsp;J/KgK</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>1.52</mn><mtext>&nbsp;J/KgK</mtext></mrow><annotation class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: class="mo">1.52</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;J/KgK</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>CS CamScanne</p><p>9.) A 0.5 mole of gas at temp 300K expands isotherm from an initial volume of 2L to 6L.</p><p>a) What is the work done by the gas?
b) Estimate the heat added to the gas?
c) What is the final pressure of the gas? (Take the value of the gas constant, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8.31</mn><mtext>J/mol</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mi>K</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">R = 8.31 \text{J/mol} \cdot K</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.00773em;">R</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">8.31</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">J/mol</span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">⋅</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">K</span></span></span></span></span>)</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>M</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mtext>&nbsp;mole</mtext><mspace width="1em"></mspace><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>R</mi><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>300</mn><mtext>&nbsp;K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext>&nbsp;L</mtext><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.3</mn><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mi>log</mi><mo></mo><mrow><mo fence="true">(</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo fence="true">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mtext>&nbsp;L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
P_1 V_1 = P_2 V_2 \\
M = 0.5 \text{ mole} \quad P_1 V_1 = M R T_1 \\
T_1 = 300 \text{ K} \\
V_1 = 2 \text{ L} \quad W = 2.3 P_1 V_1 \log \left( \frac{V_2}{V_1} \right) \\
V_2 = 6 \text{ L}
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 6.6em; vertical-align: -3.05em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mo">207.75</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;bars</span></span></span></span></span></span>  |</p><ol start="10"><li>In isochoric process, 50g of H₂O is heated from 30°C to 60°C. Ignoring the slight expansion of water, calculate the change in internal energy of the water?</li></ol><p>(Specific heat of water 4184J/Kg K.)</p><p>Mass of H₂O = 0.05Kg
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>30</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mtext>C</mtext><mspace K.}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6276</mn><mtext>&nbsp;J.</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>6276</mn><mtext>&nbsp;J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
Q = m \cdot c \cdot e. \\
Q = (0.05 \times 4184 \times 30) \\
Q = 6276 \text{ J.} \\
Q = U \\
Q_{1-2} = m \cdot c \cdot v \cdot (T_2 - T_1) \\
0.05 \times 4184 \times (30) \\
= 6276 \text{ J}
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 8.4em; vertical-align: -3.95em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span CamScanner</p><ol start="11"><li>If <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>L</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">5L</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mo">5</span><span class="mord mathnormal">L</span></span></span></span></span> of water at <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mn>50</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">50^{\circ}C</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mo">5</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.6741em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">∘</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span></span></span></span></span> is mixed with <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>L</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">4L</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mo">4</span><span class="mord mathnormal">L</span></span></span></span></span> of water at <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mn>30</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">30^{\circ}C</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mo">3</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.6741em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">∘</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span></span></span></span></span>, what will be the final temperature of water? Take the specific heat capacity of water as <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>4184</mn><mi>J</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mi>K</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>K</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">4184J/KgK</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">4184</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mo">/</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">K</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s31">g</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">K</span></span></span></span></span>.</li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>50</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mi>G</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>M</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>200</mn><mi>K</mi><mi>g</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mi>G</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>M</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></msub><mi>C</mi><mi>G</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>200</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>4184</mn><mo>×</mo><mi>G</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>200</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>4184</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>G</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>20920.000</mn><mn>836800</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>25</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∘</mo></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>G</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>25</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mn>50</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mtext>Final&nbsp;temp</mtext><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>75</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
V_1 = 5L \\
T_1 = 50^{\circ}C \\
P_1 = P_2 \\
\frac{P_1 V_1}{T_1} = \frac{P_2 V_2}{T_2} \\
P = MCG. \\
M = 200Kg. \\
MCG = M_{K_2}CG \\
200 \times 4184 \times G = 200 \times 4184 \times 20 \\
G = \frac{20920.000}{836800} = 25^{\circ}
\end{array}
\quad
\begin{array}{l}
G = 25^{\circ}C \\
\Delta T_2 - T_1 = 25 \\
\Delta T_2 - \Delta T_1 = 25 \\
\Delta T_2 = 25 + 50^{\circ}C. \\
\text{Final temp} = 75^{\circ}C
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 10.9386em; vertical-align: -5.2193em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 5.7193em;"><span style="top: -7.8793em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s17"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">5</span><span class="mord mathnormal">L</span></span></span><span style="top: -6.6793em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">5</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.6741em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">∘</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span></span></span><span style="top: -5.4793em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mn>250</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation class="s19">C</span></span></span></span></span> and water is converted into steam. This steam is used to do work and heat is ejected to the surrounding air at temperature 300K. Calculate the maximum efficiency it can have?</p><ol start="12"><li></li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>L</mi></msub><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>300</mn><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>523</mn><mi>K</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.43</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>43</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">%</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
2 = 1 - \frac{T_L}{T_4} \\
= 1 - \frac{300K}{523K} = 0.43 \\
= 43\%
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 3.7661em; vertical-align: -1.633em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">43%</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.633em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>☑ 13.) A system contains <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0.15 \, \text{m}^3</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.81em;"></span><span class="mo">0.15</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">m</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> of air pressure of 3.8 bars and <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mn>1500</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">1500^{\circ}C</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mo">150</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.6741em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">∘</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span></span></span></span></span>. It is expanded adiabatically till the pressure fails to 1.0 bar. The air is then heated at a constant pressure till its enthalpy increases by 70Kg. Sketch the process on a P–V diagram and determine the total work done.
Use <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>C</mi><mi>p</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1.005</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>kJ/kgK</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">C_p = 1.005 \, \text{kJ/kgK}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.9694em; vertical-align: -0.2861em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.1514em;"><span class="s38"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">p</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.2861em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">1.005</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>C</mi><mi>v</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.714</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>kJ/kgK</mtext></mrow><annotation mathnormal" class="s19">C</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.1514em;"><span class="s38"><span class="ps" style="height: n = ? \\
W_1 - 2 = ? \\
P V^n = C \\
P_1 V_1 = m R T_1 / P_1 \\
2.6130 - 2.0060 = 0.4609 \, n + 5.4630 \, n \\
\frac{0.607}{5.9239} = 5.9239 \\
\frac{T_1}{T_2} = \left[ \frac{V_2}{V_1} \right]^{n-1} = 0.102 \\
\frac{403}{291} = \left[ \frac{2.89}{0.9875} \right]^{n-1} \\
1.3849 = 2.9265^{n-1} \\
1.3849 = n - 1 (29265) \\
1.3849 = n - 1 (0.4664) \\
1.3849 = 0.4664 \, n - 0.4664 \\
1.3849 + 0.4664 = 0.4664 \, n \\
\frac{1.85126}{0.4664} = 0.4664 \quad \frac{0.4664}{0.4664} = 3.969 \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 17.8283em; vertical-align: -8.6641em;"></span><span class="mo"><span scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.690465</mn><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>R</mi><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>0.2</mn><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>0.241</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>438</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mn>0.2</mn></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
m = 5 \, \text{kg} \\
P_1 = 1 \, \text{mpa} \\
T_1 = 300^\circ \text{C} + 273 = 573 \, \text{K} \\
P_2 = 0.2 \, \text{mpa} \\
T_2 = 165^\circ \text{C} + 273 = 438 \, \text{K} \\
C_p = 1.011 \, \text{kJ/kgK}, \\
C_V = 0.77 \, \text{kJ/kgK}
\end{array}
\quad
\begin{array}{l}
P_1 V_1 = m R T_1 \\
1 \times V_1 = (5 \times 0.241 \times 573) \\
V_1 = 690.465 \, \text{m}^3 \\
= 0.690465 \, \text{m}^3
\end{array}
\quad
\begin{array}{l}
P_2 V_2 = m R T_2 \\
0.2 V_2 = (5 \times 0.241 \times 438) \\
0.2
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 8.4em; vertical-align: -3.95em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 4.45em;"><span style="top: -6.61em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">5</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">kg</span></span></span></span><span style="top: 10^3 \times (438 - 573) \\
= -519.750 \, \text{J} \\
= -519.750 \, \text{kJ}.</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.3669em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" 1 \times V_1 = (2 \times 0.241 \times 10^3) \\

= 0.690465 \, \text{m}^3
\end{array}

0.2 V_2 = (5 \times 0.241 \times 438) \\
0.2

encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}

\frac{\log 5}{\log 3.82198} = n \log 3.82198 \\
\log 3.82198 \, \log 3.82198 \\

xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mo>×</mo><mn>0.690465</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mo>×</mo><mn>2.63895</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1.2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>813.375</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>kJ</mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
N = 1.2 \\
W_{1.2} = \frac{P_1 V_1 - P_2 V_2}{n - 1} \\
\frac{10^6 \times 0.690465 - 0.2 \times 10^6 \times 2.63895}{1.2 - 1} \\
= \frac{690.465 - 527790}{0.2} \\
= 813.375 \, \text{kJ}.
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 6.3181em; vertical-align: -2.9091em;"></span><span class="mo"><span displaystyle="false"><mi>ϕ</mi></mstyle></mtd><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mo l}
\phi &amp;amp; = C_v (T_2 - T_1) \, n - \tau \\
&amp;amp; = 678 (110.24) \times 1.06 \\
&amp;amp; = 1.06
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 3.6em; vertical-align: -1.55em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="s3"></span><span class="mo">1.06</span></span></span><span style="top: -1.81em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">am</span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="mpunct">;</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">1.06</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.55em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>① Cyclic process → process in which the state of the system at the end is same as the state of the beginning (initial state)</p><p>② Reversible process → process that can be reverted to return both the system and its environment back to their original states together.</p><p>③ Thermodynamic process → Manner in which a state of a system can change from initial state to final state.</p><p>④ Adiabatic process → process during which no heat is transferred to or from the system.</p><p>i) Steam at 140 bar has an enthalpy of 3001.9 KJ/kg, and the temperature the specific volume, and the internal energy.</p><p>Pressure of steam, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>140</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">p = 140</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.625em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mo">140</span></span></span></span></span> bar
Enthalpy of steam, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3001.9</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">h = 3001.9</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mo">3001.9</span></span></span></span></span> KJ/kg</p><p>ii) Temperature:
At 140 bar, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2642.4</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">h_g = 2642.4</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.9805em; vertical-align: -0.2861em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.1514em;"><span class="s35"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" class="s31">g</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.2861em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" enthalpy of 3001.9 KJ/kg, and hence the steam is superheated.</p><p>From superheat tables at 140 bar, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3001.9</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">h = 3001.9</annotation></semantics></math></span><span of 400°C.</p><p>iii) The specific volume, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.01722</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">V = 0.01722</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="mo">0.01722</span></span></span></span></span> m³/kg.</p><p>iv) The internal energy (specific)
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>U</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>p</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3001.9</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>140</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>×</mo><mn>0.01722</mn></mrow><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>3</mn></msup></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">U = h - pV = 3001.9 - \frac{140 \times 10^5 \times 0.01722}{10^3}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mo">2760.82</span></span></span></span></span> KJ/kg.</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><ol start="2"><li>Steam at 120 bar has a specific Volume of 0.01721 m³/kg, find the temperature, enthalpy and the internal energy.</li></ol><p>i) At 120 bar, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.0143</mn><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">V_g = 0.0143 \, \text{m}^3/\text{kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.9694em; vertical-align: -0.2861em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.1514em;"><span class="s17"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" class="s31">g</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.2861em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.0641em; vertical-align:-.25em;"></span><span class="mo">0.0143</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">m</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mo">/</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">kg</span></span></span></span></span></span>, which is less than the actual specific Volume of 0.01721 m³/kg and hence the steam is superheated.</p><p>From Superheat tables at 120 bar, the specific volume is 0.01721 m³/kg at a temperature of 350°C.</p><p>ii) Enthalpy</p><p>From the steam tables the specific enthalpy at 120 bar, 350°C</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2847.7</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>kJ/kg</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">h = 2847.7 \, \text{kJ/kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">2847.7</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">kJ/kg</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>iii) Internal energy</p><p>To find internal energy, using the equation</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>U</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>p</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">U = h - pV</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">U</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.7778em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>U</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2847.7</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>120</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>×</mo><mn>0.01721</mn></mrow><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>3</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>2641.18</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>kJ/kg</mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">U = 2847.7 - \frac{120 \times 10^5 \times 0.01721}{10^3} = 2641.18 \, \text{kJ/kg}.</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">U</span><span class="ms" vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>N/m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><annotation class="mo">1.5</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.204em; dryness fraction 0.85.</li></ol><p>Pressure of steam, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math mathnormal">x</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.1514em;"><span class="s49"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" class="s31">g</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.2861em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.85</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>×</mo><mn>883</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.85</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>2598</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">= (1 - 0.85) \times 883 + 0.85 \times 2598</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.3669em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo">1</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">0.85</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s28"></span><span class="mo">883</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s28"></span><span class="mo">0.85</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mo">2598</span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2340.75</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>kJ/kg</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">= 2340.75 \, \text{kJ/kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.3669em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">2340.75</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">kJ/kg</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>CS CamScanne</p><ol start="5"><li>If a certain amount of steam is produced at a pressure of 8 bar and dryness fraction 0.8, calculate</li></ol><p>i) External work done during evaporation.</p><p>ii) Internal latent heat of steam.</p><p>Pressure of steam, P = 8 bar</p><p>Dryness fraction, xc = 0.8</p><p>At 8 bar, from steam table,</p><p>8 x 10⁵ N/m². Vg = 0.240 m²/kg</p><p>hfg = 2046.5 KJ/kg</p><ol start="7"><li>External work done during Evaporation.</li></ol><p>= P × Vg = 8 x 10⁵ x 0.8 x 0.24 N/m.</p><p>= 8 x 10⁵ x 0.8 x 0.24</p><p>10³ = 153.6 KJ</p><p>ii) Internal latent heat</p><p>= xchfg - external work √</p><p>= 0.8 x 2046.5 - 153.6</p><p>UL = 1483.6 KJ √</p><ol start="6"><li>Find the dryness fraction, specific volume and internal energy of steam at 7 bar and enthalpy 2550 KJ/kg.</li></ol><p>Pressure of steam P = 7 bar</p><p>h = 2550 KJ</p><p>From steam tables corresponding to 7 bar pressure</p><p>hf = 697 KJ/kg</p><p>hfg = 2064.9 KJ/kg</p><p>Vg = 0.273 m²/kg</p><p>Uf = 696 KJ/kg</p><p>Ug = 2573 KJ/kg</p><p>h = hf + xchfg</p><p>Dryness fraction, xc</p><p>At 7 bar, hg = 2762 KJ/kg, hence since the actual enthalpy is given as 2550 KJ/kg, the steam must be in the wet vapour state.</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><p>Now using the equation</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mi>g</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">h = h_f + x h_f g</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.9805em; vertical-align: -0.2861em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3361em;"><span class="s35"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" class="s43">f</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span volume
